result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J. Schulfer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Motion for an Extension of Time for Filing the Defendant's Notice of Intent to Seek Postconviction Relief - filed by Atty Ryan Drengler

Defendant Robert J. Schulfer in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:36 AM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

This is set for a plea today.

There is an agreement.
Defendant will plead to Count 1. 
Count 2 would be dismissed and read in.
State recommends jail and court costs, Defense is free to argue.

Atty Drengler concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY Count 1.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In

State complied with victim notification statutes. No one has appeared.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Pay a fine of $750 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
60 days to pay or set up payment plan

20 days in which to appeal.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 12, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on June 27, 2016 at 09:30 am.
filed by the State

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Robert J. Schulfer in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Defendant STANDS MUTE today. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds complaint shows probable cause. 
Court enters NOT GUILTY plea on the defendant's behalf. 

State asks the bond be continued. 
Atty Drengler reserves bond arguments for a later date. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.
filed by Atty Ryan Drengler
Atty Ryan Drengler appointed

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.   
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
No contact with Jolene Bellin or Benjamine Gaboda, residences or employment.

ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Special appearance by Atty McFarland.
ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $500 cash bond  with conditions as stated.
Atty McFarland requests a sig bond.
Court sets bond.
Initial Appearance Scheduled for:    @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch
